fact_check_explanation_title: Monkeypox simulation event doesn’t mean outbreak was planned
fact_check_explanation_summary: The virus was used in a fictional scenario during a theoretical planning event in March 2021.

fact_check_explanation_title: Out-of-date map showing high GB electricity prices compared to Europe re-emerges
fact_check_explanation_summary: A screenshot circulating on social media shows electricity prices in September 2021, and doesn’t reflect current prices.

fact_check_explanation_title: Image does not show parents of ‘trans baby’
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture of a trans couple who paused their own transitions to have a baby is being falsely labelled.

fact_check_explanation_title: Snoring doesn’t mean you’re eligible for £156 benefits a week
fact_check_explanation_summary: Many different news sites have published articles claiming that snoring could mean you're entitled to Personal Independence Payments.

fact_check_explanation_title: The EU has not set lower gas price cap than the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post claiming that the EU has set a gas price cap far lower than that of the UK is not based in fact.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mariupol concert footage doesn’t prove Ukraine isn’t a warzone
fact_check_explanation_summary: Russian forces now control the city and there was a concert there in July. Footage shows destroyed buildings in the background.

fact_check_explanation_title: WHO director Dr Tedros has been vaccinated
fact_check_explanation_summary: A clip circulating on social media has been used to claim the WHO director said he hadn’t received the Covid-19 vaccine. This isn’t true.

fact_check_explanation_title: Survey on cycling proposals not representative of all drivers
fact_check_explanation_summary: A headline in the Daily Mail claims 91% of drivers support proposals for cyclists to have registration plates.

fact_check_explanation_title: Real wages fall sharply—but not by ‘record’ amount when using best measure
fact_check_explanation_summary: When you look at people’s total pay—including bonuses—the most recent fall in real wages is not a record, although it is very large.

fact_check_explanation_title: Reports of a serial killer on the loose in Dundee are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: Multiple posts claim the same individual is active in cities around the world.

fact_check_explanation_title: President Zelenskyy did not sell 17 million hectares of land to American conglomerates
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no record of Monsanto, Cargill or DuPont having bought large swathes of land from the Ukrainian government under President Zelenskyy, despite claims on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: Energy companies won’t automatically give struggling customers £49 vouchers
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that people with less than £4 on their prepayment meter can get a £49 voucher from their energy company have been shared on social media.
